data.title: O'Connor, Sinéad - "The Music of Sinéad O'Connor" Promotional Release
data.text:
"The Music of Sinéad O'Connor" - O'Connor, Sinéad

Promotional Release

U2 Related Content:

"Heroine" (Studio Version) - The Edge, Sinéad O'Conner, & Larry Mullen Jr. (04:27)

Full Track Listing:

Disc One:

Heroine – The Edge and Sinéad O’Connor

Mandinka – Sinéad O’Connor

Just Like U Said It Would B – Sinéad O’Connor

I Want Your (Hands on Me) – Sinéad O’Connor

The Emperor’s New Clothes – Sinéad O’Connor

Three Babies – Sinéad O’Connor

I Do Not Want What I Haven’t Got – Sinéad O’Connor

Silent Night – Sinéad O’Connor

Red Football – Sinéad O’Connor

Thank You For Hearing Me – Sinéad O’Connor

Empire – Bomb the Bass featuring Sinéad O’Connor

No Man’s Woman – Sinéad O’Connor

Dancing Lessons – Sinéad O’Connor

Disc Two:

‘Til I Whisper U Something – Sinéad O’Connor

Her Mantle So Green – Sinéad O’Connor

The Moorlough Shore – Sinéad O’Connor

Troy (Phoenix from the Flame) – Sinéad O’Connor

Special Cases – Massive Attack featuring Sinéad O’Connor

This is to Mother You – Sinéad O’Connor featuring Mary J. Blige and Martha B.

I Had a Baby – Sinéad O’Connor

Take Off Your Shoes – Sinéad O’Connor

Take Me to Church – Sinéad O’Connor

Harbour – Sinéad O’Connor

In This Heart – Lais

This is a Rebel Song – No Use for a Name

Black Boys on Mopeds – Chevelle

Jackie – Placebo

Background Information

In May 2014, Sinéad O’Connor signed a new record deal, moving to Nettwerk Records. This promo release was produced by Nettwerk Records in 2015 to celebrate her career.

The release is a double CDR release containing music from her entire career. The earliest track included here is “Heroine” recorded and released in 1986. The back of the CD lists the song as hitting number 89 in the UK charts. The CD follows her career through the years, up to the 2014 release of “Take Me to Church” as a single on August 11, 2014. The second CD ends with four covers of Sinéad O’Connor songs by Lais, No Use for a Name, Chevelle and Placebo. The version of “Heroine” included here is the same version appearing on the soundtrack, and on other Sinéad O’Connor compilations.

Both CDRs are printed with graphics, and the set includes back and front inserts in a double jewel case.
